title._content: Camp of the second Connecticut regiment at Washington, in a grove on the north side of the city- Near th[e] New York 7th (LOC)

description._content: Waud, Alfred R., 1828-1891, artist. Camp of the second Connecticut regiment at Washington, in a grove on the north side of the city- Near th[e] New York 7th [1861 May ca. 20-23] 1 drawing on grey-olive paper : pencil, Chinese white, and black ink wash ; sheet 19.0 x 33.7 cm. Notes: Inscribed below image, from left to right: 4 abreast; Seargeant [sic] in front; infantry soldier; sword; bayonet; rifles; sword; bayonets. Title inscribed on verso. Rough sketch of soldiers and horses on verso. Gift, J.P. Morgan, 1919 (DLC/PP-1919:R1.2.378) Forms part of: Morgan collection of Civil War drawings. Published in: New York Illustrated News, June 8, 1861, p.76. Subjects: United States.--Army.--Connecticut Infantry Regiment, 2nd (1861) United States.--Army.--New York Infantry Regiment, 7th (Militia) (1861-1863) Military camps--Union--1860-1870. Soldiers--Union--1860-1870. Military officers--Union--1860-1870. Military training--1860-1870. United States--History--Civil War, 1861-1865--Military life--Union. United States--District of Columbia--Washington (D.C.) Format: Drawings--American--1860-1870. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Part Of: Morgan collection of Civil War drawings (Library of Congress) (DLC) 2003691200 For more information about this collection, see www.loc.gov/pictures/collection/drwg/ Persistent URL: hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.21277 Call Number: DRWG/US - Waud, no. 378
